result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Reyes

records.addlTxt:
Final status/scheduling conference on January 24, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial on January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 9:02am 
Defendant Daniel Reyes in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Daniel Reyes.  Attorney Jeffrey Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Mr. Reyes waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, Defense is requesting speedy trial with exception willing to waive until end of January to allow for scheduling. 
recess: 9:07am  

NEXT:   (1)Pretrial to be conducted informally (2) FSSC on 1/24/23 at 2:30pm (speedy, time limits waived until end of January) (3)Jury Trial on 1/30/23 at 8:30am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:25pm 
Defendant Daniel Reyes appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit at the request of Atty De La Rosa, time limits waived until 10/18/22.

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $500 CASH Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin 
recess 1:33  pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 10/18/22 at 9:00am

Order to Seal Victim Key
